intro: Bumelia nervosa, commonly known as the narrowleaf bumelia, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes plants known for their unique floral structures. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins, giving it its scientific name "nervosa." It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Bumelia nervosa is often found in moist, wooded areas and can thrive in partial to full shade.
